summary: Dr. Diaa Y. Mikhail was found guilty of unprofessional conduct and willfully making false records. He treated two family members for years, including prescribing Controlled Dangerous Substances to his wife and writing prescriptions in his wife's name for another family member overseas, while failing to maintain proper medical records. For these violations, he received a reprimand, a five-business-day license suspension, two years of probation, a $10,000 fine, and a requirement to complete courses in medical recordkeeping and professional ethics.
